title: Implement dynamic criticality computation
description:
Criticality is currently a static 0.3 that never changes. It should be a live signal computed from existing state/health data every cycle.

Design (from plan at ~/.claude/plans/twinkling-beaming-puzzle.md):

1. Add compute_criticality(state, health) function to core/controller.py
2. Maps Beer's VSM to a 0.0-1.0 spectrum:
   - 0.0 = chaos (failures, broken infra) -> stabilize
   - 0.5 = viable (healthy tension) -> ship
   - 1.0 = stagnant (nothing failing, nothing shipping) -> shake things up
3. Chaos inputs: _recent_failure_count(), cron_installed, disk_pct_used, mem_available_mb
4. Stagnation inputs: time since last success, pending task backlog, cycle throughput vs system age
5. Call in main() after check_health(), before build_prompt(): state['criticality'] = compute_criticality(state, health)
6. Add one-line interpretation hint to build_prompt() so System 5 knows what the number means

One file (controller.py), one function, two insertion points. All inputs already exist.
result: Shipped compute_criticality() in controller.py. Live signal computed every cycle from existing state/health data. Current criticality: 0.39 (pulling toward chaos due to 5 recent timeout errors - working as designed). Interpretation hint added to System 5 prompt.
